DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Investigator Clinical Trial Social Role StudyInvestigatorRoleCode
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research.:An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts or/and supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures; monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (i.e., under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject), collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:The action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group._The role that an investigator assumes on a study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Investigator Clinical Trial Social Role
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research.:An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts or/and supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures; monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (i.e., under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject), collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:The action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research.:An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts or/and supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures; monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (i.e., under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject), collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.

Property.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:The action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.

Concepts.definition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The role that an investigator assumes on a study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.

Concepts.definition: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An investigator designated to a specific study location.

Concepts.definition: An investigator designated to a specific study location.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An investigator designated to a specific study location.:An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.

Concepts.definition: An investigator designated to a specific study location.
An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
